page.title: 15A Small Farm Near Redditch.
page.content: {'Laurel Farm',}owned by Mr. and Mrs. Dickenson in{Beoley}has been handed down through{several generations.}They find farming both interesting and important. They own{36 acres}of land, 10 of which they use for{crops,}and the remainder for{grazing}their 250 sheep. They also keep poultry. The Dickensons start work at{7.30am.}and feed the animals on bought grain. When the weather is bad in winter, the day starts at{6.00am.}to enable hay and grain to be transported to the animals.{Silage}is not grown. The animals must be checked for illness, then eggs are collected to be sold from the farmhouse. Laurel Farm is not very large and has not invested in{ {mechanical aids}beyond the usual tractors. The Dickensons do not employ any farm hands to help with the work.
